TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_E_03
TestCase.Purpose: This test case checks the behavior of the eID-Client in case the TC Token Provider only supports the Cipher Suites that are not conforming to [TR-03124-1].
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.
The cipher suites listed in the ICS are conform to the [TR-03124-1].

TestStep.Description: [TC_TOKEN_URL] is a valid https-URL where the TC Token can be retrieved by the eID-Client.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client is activated and starts establishment of channel TLS-1-2 to the TC Token Provider.
the eID-Client only offer/support cipher suites for TLS-1-2 stated in the ICS.

Command.Text: The TC Token Provider restricts the TLS parameters for connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The TC Token Provider uses TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_K] from [CERT_SET_3].
The TC Token Provider only supports a cipher suite not conforming to [TR-03124-1] and is therefore not offered/supported by the eID-Client. Therefore the TC Token Provider rejects the connection.

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS-1-2 channel is not established.
The eID-Client returns an error "Not Found" to the browser. In case of a web server based Client-Interface, the HTTP error code is "404 Not Found".
